item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Veronica add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The hottest places in hell are reserved for those who, in times of great moral crisis, maintain their neutrality." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "In that book which is my memory, On the first page of the chapter that is the day when I first met you, Appear the words, ‘Here begins a new life’." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Dante
item.description: "Remember tonight... for it is the beginning of always" -- Dante

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "The more a thing is perfect, the more if feels pleasure and pain." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Whereas story is processed in the mind in a straightforward manner, poetry bypasses rational thought and goes straight to the limbic system and lights it up like a brushfire. It's the crack cocaine of the literary world." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Religion isn't the cause of wars, it's the excuse." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Her majesty is one verb short of a sentence." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Veronica add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Herbert Hoover
item.description: "Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die." -- Herbert Hoover

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once there was a tree, and she loved a little boy." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Lauren Willig
item.description: "Old books exert a strange fascination for me -- their smell, their feel, their history; wondering who might have owned them, how they lived, what they felt." -- Lauren Willig

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jess C. Scott
item.description: "When someone loves you, the way they say your name is different. You know that your name is safe in their mouth." -- Jess C. Scott

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Veronica add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote
